meanings.definition: involving or indicating an emotional or subjective association
meanings.sent1: Her connotative words made me feel happy.
meanings.sent2: The connotative tone of the poem evoked strong emotions.
meanings.sent3: His connotative description of the party was so exaggerated!
meanings.sent4: The connotative sunset painted the sky with warm hues.
meanings.sent5: The connotative music filled the room with nostalgia.

meanings.definition: suggesting or implying something beyond the literal meaning
meanings.sent1: The connotative gesture hinted at a hidden message.
meanings.sent2: His connotative smile revealed his true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The connotative look she gave him was mischievous.
meanings.sent4: The connotative silence in the room spoke volumes.
meanings.sent5: The connotative artwork left viewers pondering its deeper meaning.
